LanguageData.RimbodyFatTooltip: The amount of Fat. Physical activities will help pawns lose fat. Sedentary jobs, not so much.
LanguageData.RimbodyMuscleTooltip: The amount of muscle. The bar above shows how much muscle the pawn has gained. When they rest, the gain will convert into muscle.
LanguageData.Rimbody_EditModeTooltip: Left-click a field to increase, right-click to decrease
LanguageData.RimbodyRateFactorTooltip: The rate factor determines how quickly muscle and fat change. Setting it to 2 will make them change twice as fast, while setting it to 0.5 will halve the speed.
LanguageData.RimbodyGenderDifferenceTooltip: Male pawns are more likely to gain muscle. Female pawns takes 1.5 more fat to appear fat than male pawns.
LanguageData.RimbodyShowFleckTooltip: Show fleck icon when pawns are doing strength or cardio workouts.
LanguageData.RimbodyModeTooltipPerformance: Rimbody info is updated every 150 ticks, just like needs. It is extremely light, but may lead to some inaccuracies in detecting pawns' actions.
LanguageData.RimbodyModeTooltipOptimized: Rimbody info is updated every 75 ticks. This mode offers better detection than Performance mode with almost no effect on performance.
LanguageData.RimbodyModeTooltipPrecision: Rimbody info is updated every 30 ticks. Very accurate while maintaining decent performance.
LanguageData.RimbodyModeTooltipUltra: Rimbody info is updated every 15 ticks. It is extremely accurate, though it may impact performance.
LanguageData.RimbodyFatThreshholdFatTooltip: Above this amount of fat, a pawn will have the Fat body type.
LanguageData.RimbodyFatThresholdThinTooltip: Below this amount of fat, a pawn will have the Thin body type.
LanguageData.RimbodyMuscleThresholdHulkTooltip: Above this amount of muscle, a pawn will have the Hulk body type.
LanguageData.RimbodyMuscleThresholdThinTooltip: Below this amount of muscle, a pawn will have the Thin body type.
LanguageData.RimbodyGracePeriodTooltip: A pawn should have this much muscle/fat more or less than the threshold for their body type to change.
LanguageData.RimbodyNonSenescentpointTooltip: Pawns with Non-senescent genes past this age will be considered having a body of this age.
LanguageData.RimbodyDefaultSettingTooltip: Reset the settings to their default values.
LanguageData.RimbodyRefreshTooltip: Use this if to refresh the bodytype in case there is a mismatch between muscle/fat and bodytype due to other mods.
LanguageData.RimbodyGainGoalTooltip: When gain goal exceeds their muscle level, pawns will eat more often and focus on strength exercises.
LanguageData.RimbodyDietGoalTooltip: When diet goal is below their fat level, pawns will only eat when hungry and will focus on cardio exercises.
LanguageData.RimbodyWorkOutGainEfficiencyTooltip: How efficiently a pawn gains muscle during strength training.
LanguageData.RimbodyCarryRateMultiplierTooltip: The multiplier for how much the character gains muscle based on the weight of the carried object.
LanguageData.RimbodyUseFatigueTooltip: Activates the fatigue system for specific body parts. As a pawn works out or do labor, the areas used will accumulate fatigue. Exercises that use fatigued areas are less effective. Resting will help the fatigued area recover.
LanguageData.RimbodyUseExhaustionTooltip: Activates the exhaustion system. Exhaustion limits the amount of workouts you can do without rest.
LanguageData.RimbodyExhaustionTooltip: Exhaustion ({0}%)\n\nA pawn gains exhaustion while exercising. If their exhaustion reaches 100%, they must wait until it drops below 40% before they can work out again.
LanguageData.RimbodyFatigueTooltip:
As a pawn works out or do labor, the areas used will accumulate fatigue. Exercises that use fatigued areas are less effective.

Parts Fatigue

Shoulders: ({0}%)
Chest: ({1}%)

LanguageData.dumbbells_overheadshoulderpress_report: Doing overhead shoulder presses with dumbbells
LanguageData.halteres_overheadshoulderpress_report: Doing overhead shoulder presses with halteres
LanguageData.reactivetraining_report: Doing reactive training with a spinning dummy
